content: <ce:section-title id="st0035">Experimental</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0035" view="all">In a typical synthesis procedure of Co(dpa)(2,2′-bipy)(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>, 0.0735<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g Co(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (≥<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>99%), 0.1337<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g 2,2′-diphenic acid (96%), 0.0429<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g 2,2′-bipyridine (99%) and 15<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL redistilled water were mixed in a 25<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL Teflon-lined autoclave reactor. The pH of reactant mixture was adjusted to 8.2 with NaOH aqueous solution. The reactor was then sealed, heated at 433<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>K for 120<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h and slowly cooled for 2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>days to room temperature. The product was washed with de-ionized water and filtrated to afford wine rod crystals of Co(dpa)(2,2′-bipy)(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> in an average yield of 26.7%. The Co(dpa)(2,2′-bipy)(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> crystal was grinded into a powder, washed with ethanol and air-dried to afford a Co(dpa)(2,2′-bipy)(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> powder (Co-CP) that was used as the catalyst for cyclohexene oxidation. Anal. Calc. for Co(dpa)(2,2′-bipy)(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>: Co, 11.99; C, 58.67; H, 4.10; N, 5.70. Found: Co, 12.05; C, 57.87; H, 4.04; N, 5.53. The characterization of Co(dpa)(2,2′-bipy)(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> and catalytic tests were described in the supplementary material. The crystallographic data has been deposited as CCDC 993754.</ce:para>
clean_text:
Experimental

In a typical synthesis procedure of Co(dpa)(2,2'-bipy)(H2O)2, 0.0735g Co(NO3)2⋅6H2O (≥99%), 0.1337g 2,2'-diphenic acid (96%), 0.0429g 2,2'-bipyridine (99%) and 15mL redistilled water were mixed in a 25mL Teflon-lined autoclave reactor. The pH of reactant mixture was adjusted to 8.2 with NaOH aqueous solution. The reactor was then sealed, heated at 433K for 120h and slowly cooled for 2days to room temperature. The product was washed with de-ionized water and filtrated to afford wine rod crystals of Co(dpa)(2,2'-bipy)(H2O)2 in an average yield of 26.7%. The Co(dpa)(2,2'-bipy)(H2O)2 crystal was grinded into a powder, washed with ethanol and air-dried to afford a Co(dpa)(2,2'-bipy)(H2O)2 powder (Co-CP) that was used as the catalyst for cyclohexene oxidation. Anal. Calc. for Co(dpa)(2,2'-bipy)(H2O)2: Co, 11.99; C, 58.67; H, 4.10; N, 5.70. Found: Co, 12.05; C, 57.87; H, 4.04; N, 5.53. The characterization of Co(dpa)(2,2'-bipy)(H2O)2 and catalytic tests were described in the supplementary material. The crystallographic data has been deposited as CCDC 993754.
